intro: Dicoma anomala subsp. anomala, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Dicoma anomala subsp. anomala is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
